http://incubator.apache.org/wave/) and we use junit for our unit testing.

 > I realise this is released under the CPL license however it is not

ompatible with the Apache 2 License, which Apache require us to use. I
> > =
was
> > wondering if it would be possible to relicense the software under a=

of

olved.html#category-a
> 
> I'd like to point out that TestNG offers almost =
identical functionality to
> JUnit and it comes with Apache friendly licens=
e.

Moreover I'd like to add that due to recent work of Luk=C3=A1=C5=A1 Jun=
gmann[1] it 
should be pretty easy to migrate from JUnit4 to TestNG in an i=
ncremental 
manner. Luk=C3=A1=C5=A1 bachelor studies were successfully fini=
shed due to this project. 
Now he is looking for a suitable topic for his m=
aster thesis - so, in case 
migrating to TestNg is not as smooth as you'd l=
ike it to be, Luk=C3=A1=C5=A1 will be 
glad to solve all your inquiries as =
part of his subsequent studies.

-jt
